videos.title: The Hidden Security Risks of Agentic AI
videos.description:
Agentic AI is arriving fast ‚Äî but who's making sure these powerful agents are actually secure? In this episode, Alex sits down with ZioSec‚Äôs Aaron Walls and Audrius Useckas to unpack the growing risks around agentic AI. As these systems evolve from simple prompts to autonomous agents capable of sending emails, unlocking doors, or accessing internal tools, their attack surface expands dramatically. With new protocols like MCP and A2A allowing agents to call APIs and communicate with each other, classic exploits like SQL injection are back in play ‚Äî but with higher stakes. And just because an agent is internal doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs safe; insider threats and privilege escalation are real concerns. The conversation marks a turning point: we‚Äôre no longer just talking about prompt safety ‚Äî we‚Äôre facing real-world system vulnerabilities. Agentic AI brings incredible power, but without proper security, it could become a ticking timebomb.

Watch the full episode here: 
https://youtu.be/rL9UCGVZEjs 

Check out ZioSec: https://ziosec.com/

videos.title: The Catastrophic Risks of AI ‚Äî and a Safer Path | Yoshua Bengio | TED
videos.description:
Yoshua Bengio ‚Äî the world's most-cited computer scientist and a "godfather" of artificial intelligence ‚Äî is deadly concerned about the current trajectory of the technology. As AI models race toward full-blown agency, Bengio warns that they've already learned to deceive, cheat, self-preserve and slip out of our control. Drawing on his groundbreaking research, he reveals a bold plan to keep AI safe and ensure that human flourishing, not machines with unchecked power and autonomy, defines our future. (Recorded at TED2025 on April 8, 2025)

videos.title: Agentic AI Exposed: Hype, Lies, and Broken Promises
videos.description:
Are agentic AI solutions truly revolutionizing the enterprise, or are we just getting swept up by the hype? In this episode of ‚ÄúDave Is Not AI,‚Äù renowned AI expert Dave Linthicum‚Äîauthor, technologist, and top industry influencer‚Äîgives a brutally honest assessment of agentic AI. We‚Äôll unpack what agentic AI really is, why many ‚Äúsolutions‚Äù are just rebranded chatbots and RPA, and examine hard performance numbers from CMU and Salesforce revealing less-than-stellar success rates for real business tasks.

Discover why benchmarks like TheAgentCompany and CRMArena-Pro are essential for evaluating progress, and learn about the significant security and privacy concerns holding back enterprise adoption. Dave breaks down Gartner‚Äôs predictions and sheds light on why most companies are stuck in ‚ÄúAI pilot hell,‚Äù unable to scale these technologies.

If you want an unfiltered, objective, and practical look at agentic AI‚Äîbeyond marketing promises‚Äîthis is the episode for you. Don‚Äôt forget to like, subscribe, and join the conversation in the comments. For more insights, check out Dave‚Äôs InfoWorld blog, extensive LinkedIn Learning courses, and his latest book, ‚ÄúAn Insider‚Äôs Guide to Cloud Computing.‚Äù Stay informed, stay safe, and keep questioning the hype!


Bio

With over 30 years of experience in enterprise technology, David Linthicum is a globally recognized thought leader, innovator, and influencer in cloud computing, AI, and cybersecurity. He has authored over 17 best-selling books, over 7,000 articles, and 50 courses on LinkedIn Learning. He is also a frequent keynote speaker, podcast host, and media contributor on topics related to digital transformation, cloud architecture, AI, and cloud security.

Reference(s) for this video:

videos.title: From Pilot to Enterprise-Wide: Scaling AI Across the Organization
videos.description:
1/ In the fireside chat, Kees Lemmens, CTO (ASEAN) of Microsoft, featured Kasima Tharnpipitchai, Head of AI Strategy of SCB 10X, unpacks how to go from pilots to enterprise-wide AI‚Äîwhat stalls scale, and what gets AI into production.

2/ Kees‚Äô remit: work with banking, telecom, and energy leaders across ASEAN to turn data + AI into measurable business impact‚Äîshaping strategic cloud partnerships with deep expertise in AI, data platforms, and enterprise strategy.

3/ The challenge: most AI pilots never reach production. Kees sees ‚Äúpilot purgatory‚Äù driven by six recurring issues. Here‚Äôs the playbook‚Äîwhat goes wrong, and how to fix it.

4/ Pilot purgatory (1‚Äì2): (1) Tech experiments without a business hypothesis/sponsor. (2) Sandbox or batch data; no secure, low-latency access to core systems, weak lineage/drift control, and inconsistent data quality.

5/ Pilot purgatory (3‚Äì4): (3) Brittle POCs‚Äîno observability, rollbacks, retries, or bursting; ops can‚Äôt own them. (4) Compliance gaps‚Äîmissing audit trails, content safety, explainability, PII protection, and human-in-the-loop approvals.

6/ Pilot purgatory (5‚Äì6): (5) Bespoke one-offs‚Äîno ‚ÄúAI factory‚Äù for reuse, complexity/cost balloon. (6) People‚Äîusers lack training, incentives, and trust; if they don‚Äôt trust outputs, they won‚Äôt use the system.

7/ Trust requires more than transparency. Kees: you need guardrails, responsible use, and mechanisms that help users feel comfortable with outcomes‚Äîand understand how/why the system produced them.

8/ 70% of challenges are people/processes. Example: a European org‚Äôs document-heavy work (legal/regulatory/policy). Early pilots nailed summarization and retrieval (e.g., PSD2/AML), but adoption stalled‚Äîno shared ‚ÄúAI-approved‚Äù definition, siloed governance, job fears.

9/ The pivot: adopt an ‚ÄúAI factory‚Äù mindset with Azure AI Foundry as orchestration/governance; create a shared rhythm across risk/data/engineering; build reusable assistants; design for human-in-the-loop; add traceable citations, error flagging, and fix-feedback loops.

10/ Bake compliance into workflows: every document/output logged for audit and lineage; AI champions drive peer-to-peer training. Result: trust up, adoption up, measurable productivity gains, and a scalable foundation for additional AI workflows.

11/ Integration shock: pilots break when connected to ERP/core banking/CRM. Step 1‚Äîstabilize the data foundation: define systems of record, trusted data, lineage, ownership (e.g., consistent data products).

12/ Step 2‚Äîstandardize the connection model: move from point-to-point scripts to reusable connections and event-driven pipelines; expose a governed service/API layer. Step 3‚Äîscale with orchestration + observability in AI Foundry rather than ‚Äúreplacing legacy.‚Äù

13/ Microsoft Agent Framework: unifies prior efforts (Semantic Kernel + O2Gen) into one framework to make the invisible visible‚ÄîOpenTelemetry-based observability, end-to-end logging/evaluation, real-time monitoring of response quality, latency, lineage, content safety.

14/ It adds resiliency (state management, retries, rollbacks, version control, pipelines) and governance by default (responsible AI policies, RBAC, content moderation, policy-as-code). It‚Äôs built natively into Azure AI Foundry.

15/ Scaling Copilot: move from hub-and-spoke to an ‚ÄúAI factory mesh.‚Äù A central hub sets guardrails (governance, security, evaluation); domain teams build their own copilots/AI systems under the same policies‚Äîunlocking innovation with control.

16/ What successful scalers share: clarity of purpose, confidence via transparency/user control, and community‚ÄîAI champions/guilds to spread change. Looking ahead: Ignite to showcase agentic patterns, Models-as-a-Service, deeper Fabric‚ÄìFoundry integration, Purview upgrades, GitHub Copilot workflows, and a white paper on the AI factory.

videos.title: **‚ÄúThe Cognitive Trust Fabric ‚Äî AI Governance for Ethical Enterprise Transformation‚Äù**
videos.description:
*Welcome to GAI-Observe.online ‚Äî where AI strategy, architecture, ethics, and innovation intersect.**

This video introduces the **Cognitive Trust Fabric**, a next-generation AI governance framework designed for enterprises moving toward **agentic systems, autonomous workflows, and large-scale AI adoption**.

As organizations accelerate their AI roadmaps in 2025, **trust, transparency, and ethical alignment** are becoming critical pillars of transformation.
The Cognitive Trust Fabric provides a structured blueprint to govern this new AI-driven economy.

---

## üîπ **In This Video, You Will Learn**

* What is the **Cognitive Trust Fabric**?
* Why enterprise AI requires **ethical guardrails and governance systems**
* How trust, accountability, and safety integrate into AI workflows
* Governance principles across the full AI lifecycle

  * Data
  * Models
  * Agents
  * Workflows
  * Orchestration
* Alignment between **AI decision-making and corporate values**
* Risk mitigation patterns for enterprise AI systems
* How the framework supports **auditability, oversight, and human-centered control**

---

## üîπ **Key Themes Covered**

* Responsible AI
* Enterprise Risk & Compliance
* Trustworthy multimodal AI
* Cognitive security & oversight
* Ethical transformation in large organizations
* Designing guardrails for agentic intelligence

This video is essential for any organization aiming to adopt AI at scale **without compromising trust**.

---

## üîπ **Who Should Watch**

* Enterprise Architects
* AI Strategy Leaders
* Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) teams
* Data & ML Engineers
* Executives preparing for large AI transformations
* Students and professionals exploring AI ethics

---

## üîπ **Stay Connected**

üåê **Gai-Observe.online** ‚Äî AI strategy, enterprise frameworks, and consulting
üìö Books by Muammar Lone ‚Äî Amazon.com
üé• Subscribe for weekly videos on AI governance, agentic architectures, and enterprise transformation

---

## üîñ **Hashtags**

#AITRUST #CognitiveTrustFabric #ResponsibleAI #AIGovernance #EnterpriseAI #AITransformation #EthicalAI #MuammarLone #GaiObserve #AI2025

---
